tweets.text:
The demolition of Shade Chapel, which will help reduce flood risk in Todmorden, has progressed well this weekend. 

The roads will be reopening as planned at 6am tomorrow morning (Monday) with all diversions no longer in place. 

Thanks to residents for their support. https://t.co/auX7LoprCe

The majority of Earth's chalk streams & rivers are found in England; fragile, extraordinary ecologies.
But they're dying from water company over-extraction, pollution & @EnvAgency inaction.
@Feargal_Sharkey is leading an event (8 Dec) on stopping the rot.
https://t.co/znRcXVS58x

Four boat owners have been ordered to pay over ¬£4,000.

Don't make the same mistake as they did‚ö†Ô∏è

Register your boat or find yourself with a fineüí∏

Read more: https://t.co/qggTk820Mn #Cambridgeshire #Boats

tweets.text: @SOSCAlliance @AdrianGMoss @EnvAgencySE @SouthernWater @ChichesterDC @ChiHarbourTrust Why are nitrogen levels too high is there any link to years of Southern Water polluting

Crofters doing the annual cut of the Fishbourne tidal Reed beds. Unfortunately nitrogen levels are too high in Chichester Harbour so local thatchers now use reeds from Poland, Turkey and China. Can we revive local Reed? @EnvAgencySE @SouthernWater @ChichesterDC @ChiHarbourTrust https://t.co/Y4LejI0fsP

tweets.text:
We're back on site today as Shade Chapel is demolished to reduce flood risk in Todmorden. 

Part of Rochdale Rd & Knowlwood Rd are closed until 6am tomorrow to both vehicles and pedestrians, unless for access only. 

More info: https://t.co/uHiTK7CW54

#flooding https://t.co/QBBvZoiRbw

Why so shy @TaylorWimpey please comment back and let us know your counter - otherwise we assume you agree with us and need to cancel the Thames farm development farce straight away! @henleystandard @EnvAgencySE @thameswater @SouthOxon @BBCSouthNews @guardian @DailyMailUK https://t.co/of9MacKh4i

tweets.text: Great to be out on patrol, bumped into the MDD Polish fishing team, what a great bunch of lads, so many big Perch from the Dorset Stour! All had valid licences. What an awesome river! https://t.co/QHBBf1lcpV

Taylor Wimpy: i wouldn't trust you to drain a sink let alone a complex drainage scheme at Thames Farm Shiplake that threatens to flood homes https://t.co/HDhLV6hWQV @henleystandard @SouthOxon @dmariecraft @DornanIrene @Pete_Redfern @TaylorWimpey @TaylorWimpeyplc

This weir in Kidderminster town centre was a barrier to fish movements at low flows. In summer, with funding from @EnvAgencyMids and on behalf of our project, @SanctusLtd worked to remove a 'notch' from it, ensuring a passable flow of water at all times for all fish species. https://t.co/2l0oMcstTo

Reminder that this weekend we are demolishing Shade Chapel to reduce flood risk to Todmorden. We'll be back on site tomorrow. 

Part of Rochdale Rd & Knowlwood Rd will be closed until 6am on Monday so we can do this safely. Diversions are in place. More:  
https://t.co/kp3y70Xv4j https://t.co/DHlB8RWNNp

It will be the #ukgovernment as they have run out of hiding spaces a long time ago changed all the #environmental laws and still the @EnvAgency @scottishepa don‚Äôt have clue how to #coverup the #governemnts shame ¬£700m https://t.co/m0dtY2RpaP https://t.co/DU0Bn7FHIh

tweets.text:
We‚Äôre planning on replacing some major defences in my @EnvAgencyYNE patch.

Contractors are currently drilling 20 meters deep and taking ‚Äòcore‚Äô samples at @RotherValley.

Cores are then analysed by a geotechnical expert so we know the defence will be structurally sound. https://t.co/5kPkxKkNCy

We are excited to announce that the fish and eel pass at Saltaire has been finished.

 We are now a major step closer to returning Salmon to the river Aire for the first time in 150 years. https://t.co/kUqW6LwbQO

#DNAire #AireRiversTrust #EnvironmentAgency #Riverrestoration https://t.co/AQ2gaooeMg

urls.title: DNAire - Aire Rivers Trust

tweets.text:
We want to thank our staff who attended a major fire in Bradford last week.

More than 40 of our frontline officers worked around the clock to stop contaminated water reaching nearby rivers.  

We also set up 2 air quality monitoring units to provide public health information. https://t.co/PmAPTqSa3E

Read about the work we did for the @EnvAgency when
Shoreham-by-Sea was at severe risk of #flooding and existing tidal flood defences were not sufficient: https://t.co/jzsP7O8d1w https://t.co/oKavGJHfQZ

tweets.text:
@martr101 @stillawake @TRESAcic @Bristol_People @Totterdown_ @BristolCouncil @LabourBristol @nicolabeech @harbour_news @hccabristol @bgreencapital @GlobalSciShow @BathArchandCivE @EnvAgencySW @ICESouthWest @CIWEM This was a technical talk by engineers for engineers; the modelling process and design proposals were presented with evidence and enthusiasm. 

I'm now going to read up and prepare a response - and keep fighting for municipal engineering education https://t.co/eWtcBhDBgw

I will not stop posting videos and pictures of the mess we have to walk through EVERYDAY @A2DominionGroup this is shameful esp the amount of service charges I pay for each month. @LBofHounslow @EIA_News https://t.co/PWRGNMDyn8

@stillawake @FiDaisyG @TRESAcic @Bristol_People @Totterdown_ @BristolCouncil @LabourBristol @nicolabeech @harbour_news @hccabristol @bgreencapital @GlobalSciShow @BathArchandCivE @EnvAgencySW @ICESouthWest @CIWEM the three speakers were 2 x ARUP and 1 x @BristolCouncil say no more  They are determined to build anyway they are allowed. They think barrier too expensive and won't wait for government infrastructure funding. If a job is worth doing, don't bodge it for future generations.
